historicalContext.historicalPeriod: Kojiki (712 CE) and Nihon Shoki (720 CE)
historicalContext.sourceText: Kojiki - Book 1: Creation myth; Nihon Shoki - Primordial deities

shrineSites.name: Izanagi Shrine (Izanagi-jingu)
shrineSites.notes: One of the oldest shrines in Japan

festivalAssociations.name: Izanagi Matsuri
festivalAssociations.significance: Celebration of creation and primordial deity

imperialConnections.imperialLegitimacy: Grandfather of Amaterasu - grandfather of imperial line

historicalNotes: Creation myth parallels: Mesopotamian, Polynesian traditions
Shinto concept of purification (misogi) originating from his purification
Yomi (underworld) visit establishes death realm mythology
Post-death form influenced later Buddhist concepts of hell
